"We should therefore like to discuss with appropriate individuals in the
U.S. Office of Education the role which the NAE& in view of its qualifications a
set forth above, might most usefully play in this important effort.
For that reason no specific request is presented at this time. As a result
of the discussions we now request#we would hope to find the arrangement, on
either a contractual or grant-in-aid basis, which would best serve the interests
envisioned in the National Defense Education Act, and the needs of U.S.
Education, under the administration .of the U.S. Office of Education.
We therefore respectfully request a conference in which we might discuss
steps which should now be taken to put our qualifications and energies at the
service of the Office of Education, this Act, and U.S. Education, in the most
efficient and effective way.
F. E. Schooley, President
National Association of
Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
HJS:jg Urbana, Illinois
October 24, 1958
